title: Printer Comparison
question_text: A small boutique owner ships her own products when ordered online. Recently, she bought two printers, Printer A and Printer B, to help with the process. She then uses Printer A for $30$ labels  and then Printer B for $30$ labels, then compares the results. What question is the shop owner most likely trying to answer?

choices.text: Which printer expediates the shipping process?
Does the boutique need two printers?

solution:
The shop owner is using data collection to determine a potential solution in her shipping process. She is comparing the two different printers, A and B, while printing 30 30 labels from each printer.

Although some of the other answers might seem correct, the owner is most likely looking to see which printer expediates the shipping process. By printing the same amount of labels from each printer, she is more than likely looking at which printer will make shipping her products easiest.

Choice 'B' is correct.
